title: Ticket #4032: Add $(RETRY) to VARS options in DAGMan
description: Brian Bockelman wanted to have output files from his job named by the retry. He can do this indirectly by renaming them with a POST script, but it would be easier and more elegant to allow $(RETRY) to be passed as a VARS value, so it could be used in the submit file and you wouldn't have to do the renaming.
remarks:
2013-Nov-04 08:30:49 by bbockelm:
It would actually be useful to have both the $(RETRY) available to VARS and have it available in the job ad.

Most users would likely only use VARS, but I have use cases for both. $(RETRY) would be useful for renaming stdout but various job monitoring systems would like to be able to query the ad for the retry name.

(Changing customer group to CMS as that's where the use cases are coming from.)

2013-Nov-04 11:40:43 by wenger:
Okay, this should be pretty easy to do (both VARS and classad attribute) -- I'm going to bump it up to priority 3...

2013-Nov-18 10:54:01 by bbockelm:
Hi,

Can I bump this ticket? I'd additionally like to get this slated for a stable series release...

Brian

2013-Nov-18 12:02:37 by wenger:
I was actually planning to work on this ticket this week.

But getting it into the stable series may be a little questionable. How critical is that for you? You can use an 8.1 DAGMan with an 8.0 schedd, etc.
